page.title: 20Communication
page.content: The usual methods of communication i.e. post, telephone and word of mouth apply to this area. As in most rural areas messages are carried by the grocery ven, the butcher and the postman. Television is available in almost all homes and reception is good. There is a local, free weekly paper, and the post office sells all the usual daily papers plus the weekly Ulverston News and the Westmorland Gazette. It is a singularly self contained population not concerned with outside issues. Life is very safe and very sweet and one feels that the locals are closely in touch with nature. This information was compiled by the Rusland and District Women's Institute.
